claims.object: stock of all dispersal units in the soil

surface_layer.definition: A seed bank is the reserve of viable seeds present in the soil.

deep_layer.mechanism: Seed banks provide a buffer against environmental fluctuations and disturbances.
deep_layer.origin: Seed banks are formed by seed rain from surrounding vegetation.

examples: Soil seed bank in a grassland ecosystem
Soil seed bank in a forest understory

citations: Spatial Distribution of Plants and Plant Communities Chapter 6, Spatial Pattern and Indices of Dispersion
